console.log(`Quad size: ${size} bytes`);

@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview useZod composable - Dynamic Zod schema generation from RDF data This composable generates Zod schemas dynamically from RDF data patterns. Focuses on 80/20 use cases: generating schemas from SPARQL results and RDF shapes. @version 1.0.0 @author GitVan Team @license MIT

@unrdf/composables.name: useValidator
@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview useValidator composable - SHACL validation helpers Provides a thin, opinionated wrapper around the shared RdfEngine so contributors always reach for the same validation workflow.

@unrdf/composables.name: useTurtle

It handles loading, saving, and managing .ttl files with automatic parsing and serialization to/from N3.Store. @version 1.0.0 @author GitVan Team @license MIT

@unrdf/composables.name: useTerms
@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview useTerms composable - RDF term creation with context and configuration This composable provides convenient RDF term creation with base IRI resolution, default datatypes, and type conversion. It wraps N3 DataFactory with additional functionality while maintaining compatibility with the core RDF data model. @version 1.0.0 @author GitVan Team @license MIT

@unrdf/composables.name: useSubscription
@unrdf/composables.description: useSubscription Composable - Change Feed Subscriptions Subscribe to real-time RDF change feeds with reactive updates. Supports filtering and automatic cleanup on unmount. @module composables/use-subscription

@unrdf/composables.name: useStreaming
@unrdf/composables.description: useStreaming Composable - Real-time Stream Processing Process real-time RDF change streams with batching and debouncing. Optimized for high-frequency updates. @module composables/use-streaming

@unrdf/composables.name: useReasoner
@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview useReasoner composable - High-level reasoning convenience layer This composable provides a simple, intuitive interface for reasoning operations. It abstracts away store management, rule parsing, and result handling. @version 2.0.0 @author GitVan Team @license MIT

@unrdf/composables.name: useQuery
@unrdf/composables.description: useQuery Composable - Reactive SPARQL Query Execution Execute SPARQL queries on RDF stores with reactive results. Supports auto-execution on store changes and result memoization. @module composables/use-query

@unrdf/composables.name: usePrefixes
@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview usePrefixes composable - opinionated prefix registry helpers

@unrdf/composables.name: useGraph
@unrdf/composables.description: @fileoverview useGraph composable - high-level RDF graph operations with context This composable provides the main interface for RDF operations. It wraps a store with common graph operations like SPARQL queries, set operations, and traversal utilities. Now uses unctx for store access. @version 1.0.0 @author GitVan Team @license MIT

@unrdf/composables.name: useDelta
@unrdf/composables.description: useDelta Composable - Undo/Redo Delta Management Track RDF store changes with undo/redo capabilities. Maintains a history of deltas for state restoration. @module composables/use-delta

@unrdf/composables.name: useCanon

@unrdf/core.name: CircuitState
@unrdf/core.description: @file Circuit Breaker Pattern for Fault Tolerance @module knowledge-engine/utils/circuit-breaker @description Implements the circuit breaker pattern for fault tolerance in distributed operations like federation, remote SPARQL endpoints, and external services. States: - CLOSED: Normal operation, requests pass through - OPEN: Circuit tripped, requests fail immediately - HALF_OPEN: Testing if service recovered

@unrdf/core.name: defaultRegistry
@unrdf/core.description: Circuit breaker configuration schema @typedef {Object} CircuitBreakerConfig @property {number} [failureThreshold=5] - Failures before opening circuit @property {number} [resetTimeout=30000] - Time in ms before trying half-open @property {number} [halfOpenMaxCalls=3] - Max calls in half-open state @property {number} [successThreshold=2] - Successes in half-open to close @property {string} [name='circuit-breaker'] - Name for tracing @property {Function} [onStateChange] - Callback on state transitions @property {Function} [isFailure] - Custom failure detection function

@unrdf/core.name: createCircuitBreaker
@unrdf/core.description: Create a circuit breaker with default configuration

@unrdf/core.name: withCircuitBreaker

@unrdf/core.name: streamingParse
@unrdf/core.description: @fileoverview N3 Justified-Only Module - The ONLY module allowed to import N3 directly 100% COMPLIANCE ENFORCEMENT: - This module is the SINGLE SOURCE for all N3 functionality - All other modules MUST import from this module, NOT from 'n3' directly - Justification: Streaming RDF parsing/writing requires N3's SAX-like API ALLOWED N3 FEATURES (Streaming & Performance): 1. Parser.parse() - Streaming RDF parsing (SAX-like, not DOM-based) 2. Writer - Streaming RDF serialization (no memory buffering) 3. StreamParser/StreamWriter - Backpressure-aware streaming FORBIDDEN (Use Oxigraph instead): - Store - Use Oxigraph Store - DataFactory - Use Oxigraph NamedNode, Literal, etc - Quad operations - Use Oxigraph Quad @module @unrdf/core/rdf/n3-justified-only

@unrdf/core.name: streamParse
@unrdf/core.description: @file (O) Minimal-N3 Integration - Canonical Reference Implementation @module @unrdf/core/rdf/minimal-n3-integration This module demonstrates the (O) (Minimal-N3) architectural principle: - Oxigraph is the authoritative engine for ALL operations - N3 is invoked ONLY at 5 justified boundaries where Oxigraph cannot act - All N3 operations MUST re-enter Oxigraph immediately Justified N3 Use Cases (ONLY these 5): 1. Streaming parsing (input > memory budget or backpressure required) 2. Streaming serialization (output must stream to sink) 3. N3 rule reasoning (forward-chaining, not in Oxigraph) 4. Permissive parsing (dirty/malformed RDF input) 5. Structural RDF transforms (cannot express in SPARQL 1.1) Everything else: Use Oxigraph ONLY.

@unrdf/core.name: streamSerialize
@unrdf/core.description: Case 2: Streaming Serialize (N3 justified - output streaming) Use when: Output must stream to sink (HTTP response, file write with backpressure)

@unrdf/core.name: applyN3Rules

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: now
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: KGC Time Module - Nanosecond-precision BigInt timestamps Uses process.hrtime.bigint() in Node.js and performance.now() in Browser

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: hasClockJumpDetected
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Check if a clock jump was detected

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: resetClockJumpDetection
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Reset clock jump detection flag

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: toISO
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Convert nanosecond BigInt to ISO 8601 string WARNING: Truncates to millisecond precision (loses sub-millisecond nanoseconds) Input: 1000000123456789n (with 123456789 ns = 123.456789 ms) Output: 1970-01-01T00:00:00.123Z (only 123 ms preserved, 456789 ns lost) Use this only for display/logging. For time-travel, compare BigInt timestamps directly.

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: fromISO
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Convert ISO 8601 string to nanosecond BigInt Preserves nanosecond precision from fractional seconds (e.g., .123456789) Standard Date.parse() truncates to milliseconds - this preserves all 9 digits FRACTIONAL SECONDS SEMANTICS: - Input ".1" is treated as ".100000000" (100 milliseconds = 100,000,000 nanoseconds) - Input ".123456789" is treated as 123,456,789 nanoseconds - Input with no fractional seconds defaults to ".000000000" DATE VALIDATION: - Validates month (1-12), day (1-31 with month-specific limits), hour (0-23), minute/second (0-59) - Rejects February 31, April 31, etc. - Accepts leap years correctly (Feb 29 in 2020, 2024, etc.) - Rejects leap seconds (second = 60)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: addNanoseconds
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Add nanoseconds to a BigInt timestamp GAP-T5 fix: Enforce strict BigInt type for delta to prevent unit confusion

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: duration
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Calculate duration between two nanosecond timestamps

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardMonotonicOrdering
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: KGC 4D Poka Yoke Guards - Mistake-Proofing Controls Implements 24 guards from FMEA analysis to achieve near-zero-defect quality Pattern: Each public API validates inputs at entry point (fail-fast principle) Guards throw descriptive errors immediately to surface bugs during development

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardTimeEnvironment
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard T2: Validate now() environment Prevents: Invalid timestamp in wrong environment (browser vs Node.js) Action: Check both process.hrtime.bigint and performance.now exist

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardISOFormat
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard T3: Validate ISO date format Prevents: Silent NaN from malformed ISO strings Action: Check format with regex and validate date parsing

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardBigIntRange
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard T4: Validate BigInt range Prevents: BigInt overflow or wrap-around Action: Check timestamp within safe range (now and future)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardBigIntPrecision
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard T5: Validate BigInt-to-Number precision Prevents: Precision loss in millisecond conversion Action: Document and validate conversion safety

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardEventIdGeneration
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S1: Validate event ID generation Prevents: Missing or duplicate event IDs Action: Ensure UUID format, fallback with timestamp+random

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardPayloadJSON
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S2: Validate event payload JSON Prevents: JSON.parse() crash on malformed payload Action: Try-catch and validate schema

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardQuadStructure
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S3: Validate RDF quad structure Prevents: Undefined reference error on quad.object.value Action: Check all required quad properties exist

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardDeltaType
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S4: Validate delta type whitelist Prevents: Silently skipped mutations from typos Action: Enforce only 'add' or 'delete'

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardEventCountOverflow
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S5: Validate event count doesn't overflow Prevents: Event count wrap-around after Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER Action: Use BigInt, validate increments

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardGraphsExport
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard S6: Validate GRAPHS constant exports Prevents: Circular import or missing export causing undefined GRAPHS Action: Assert all required graph URIs present

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardGitRepository
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G1: Validate Git repository Prevents: execSync failure with cryptic error in non-git folder Action: Check .git directory exists before operations

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardSnapshotWrite
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G2: Validate snapshot file state Prevents: Race condition overwriting snapshot before commit Action: Use atomic write with temp file

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardCommitHash
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G3: Validate Git commit hash format Prevents: Hash extraction failure or null return Action: Validate with regex, ensure 7+ char hex

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardSnapshotExists
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G4: Validate snapshot exists before read Prevents: Silent ghost data from non-existent commit Action: Verify git ref points to valid object

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardCommitMessageSafety
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G5: Prevent command injection in commit message Prevents: Shell escaping bypass, command injection Action: Use --message argument instead of shell interpolation (already done)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardNQuadsEncoding
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard G6: Validate N-Quads UTF8 encoding Prevents: Git corruption from non-UTF8 RDF data Action: Ensure N-Quads string is valid UTF8

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardEmptyUniverseFreeze
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard F1: Warn on empty universe freeze Prevents: Silent false snapshot of empty state Action: Log warning but allow operation (empty freeze valid)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardBLAKE3Hash
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard F2: Validate BLAKE3 hash format Prevents: Corrupted hash from reordered or truncated quads Action: Validate 64-char hex (BLAKE3 in hex)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardGitRefIntegrity
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard F3: Validate Git reference integrity Prevents: Data loss from corrupted or lost git ref Action: Verify git ref exists and is valid commit

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardReceiptSchema
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard F4: Validate receipt payload schema Prevents: Deserialization crash from malformed receipt Action: Validate all receipt fields present

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardTimeGap
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard F5: Validate time-travel target is achievable Prevents: Silent failure when reconstructState() finds no snapshot Action: Check gap between snapshots, throw if unreasonable

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardArgumentType
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard A1: Enforce runtime type checking Prevents: Type mismatches from missing TypeScript Action: Check argument types at entry point

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardNotNull
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard A2: Enforce null/undefined check Prevents: Null reference errors from missing required arguments Action: Throw immediately if null/undefined

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardArgumentShape
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard A3: Validate argument shape (array vs object) Prevents: Type confusion between array and object arguments Action: Check with Array.isArray() or typeof

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardModuleExports
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard A4: Validate module exports at load time Prevents: Circular import causing undefined exports Action: Assert all required exports present on module load

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardPublicAPI
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard A5: Validate all public API exports Prevents: Accidental removal of exported function during refactoring Action: List and test all exports

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardAtomicWrite
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard C1: Atomic write during freeze Prevents: Race condition from concurrent freeze operations Action: File-lock during commit (implemented in GitBackbone)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardEventIDUniqueness
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard C2: Prevent event ID collision Prevents: Duplicate event IDs from weak UUID generation Action: Validate UUID format and check uniqueness

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardTimeStateEncapsulation
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard C3: Encapsulate lastTime variable Prevents: External mutation of time state Action: No direct access to lastTime (module-level private)

@unrdf/kgc-4d.name: guardEventCountConsistency
@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Guard C4: Validate event count consistency Prevents: Stale event count after crash or restart Action: Recompute from store on initialization

@unrdf/kgc-4d.description: Export all guards for testing and usage

@unrdf/knowledge-engine.name: defineHook
@unrdf/knowledge-engine.description: @file 80/20 Knowledge Hook definition contract for autonomic systems. @module newco/defineHook @description This module provides the `defineHook` function, the sole entry point for defining a Knowledge Hook. The contract enforces critical principles for autonomic, deterministic, and provable systems: 1.  Conditions are Addressed, Not Embedded: The `when` clause MUST reference an external, content-addressed SPARQL or SHACL file. This forbids inline query strings, ensuring that governance logic is a verifiable, standalone artifact. 2.  Reflex Arc Lifecycle: The `before`, `run`, and `after` functions provide a minimal, complete lifecycle for autonomic reflexes: - `before`: A pre-condition gate for payload normalization or cancellation. - `run`: The core effect or analysis. - `after`: A post-execution step for auditing and cleanup. 3.  Declarative Configuration: Determinism and receipting strategies are declared as metadata, not implemented imperatively within the hook. 4.  Comprehensive Validation: Uses Zod schemas for complete type safety and validation of all hook components. This API is designed to feel familiar to users of Nitro's `defineTask` while being fundamentally adapted for a knowledge-native, policy-first runtime.

@unrdf/knowledge-engine.name: exampleComplianceHook
@unrdf/knowledge-engine.description: This is an example of how to use `defineHook` to create a compliance gate. It demonstrates all the core features of the 80/20 contract.
